revised_title: Structure and Specificity of Antibody Molecules: A Discussion on the Physics and Chemistry of Biological Recognition
tldr: This article discusses the structure and specificity of antibody molecules, focusing on the role of hypervariable regions in defining the active site and determining the specificity of antibodies. The author also explores the potential economy of design in the immune system and the challenges posed by the large number of antibody specificities. The study of antibody structure and function has important implications for understanding the immune response and developing treatments for various diseases.
